org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.tests.replicationTests

Class ReplicationRun

  • java.lang.Object
    • junit.framework.Assert
      • junit.framework.TestCase
        • org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.BaseTestCase
          • org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.tests.replicationTests.ReplicationRun
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    junit.framework.Test
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ReplicationRun_CleanUp, ReplicationRun_Distributed, ReplicationRun_Full, ReplicationRun_Local, ReplicationRun_Local_1, ReplicationRun_Local_1Indexing, ReplicationRun_Local_3, ReplicationRun_Local_3_p4, ReplicationRun_Local_Derby4910, ReplicationRun_Local_Encrypted_1, ReplicationRun_Local_showStateChange, ReplicationRun_Local_StateTest_part1, ReplicationRun_Local_StateTest_part1_1, ReplicationRun_Local_StateTest_part1_2, ReplicationRun_Local_StateTest_part1_3, ReplicationRun_Local_StateTest_part2

    public class ReplicationRun
extends BaseTestCase
    Framework to run replication tests. Subclass to create specific tests as in ReplicationRun_Local and ReplicationRun_Distributed.

      • helperThreads

        private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Thread> helperThreads
        List of threads that have been started by the tests and not explicitly waited for. Wait for these to complete in tearDown() so that they don't interfere with subsequent test cases.

        private void runUserCommandLocally(java.lang.String[] command,
                                   java.lang.String ID,
                                   java.io.File workingDir)
        Run a Java command locally on the test host. The spawned process inherits the class path from the main test process.
        Parameters:
        command - the arguments to pass to the Java executable
        ID - an identifier used to prefix debug output
        workingDir - the directory in which the sub-process should run, or null to run in the same directory as the parent process

      • assertSqlStateSlaveConn

        protected void assertSqlStateSlaveConn(java.lang.String expected)
                                throws java.lang.Exception
        Assert that the latest startSlave connection attempt got the expected SQLState. The method will wait for upto 5 seconds for the startSlave connection attemt to complete. If the connection attempt has not completed after 5 seconds it is assumed to have failed.
        Parameters:
        expected - the expected SQLState
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - the Exception to check the SQLState of
